Text.Value: We had a deal - the orthon for information.
The arousals and appetites of man will return to him, and unlike you, he will have no need of a parasite to protect him from the sun.
I need to take the fight to him.
We can't let Cazador complete that ritual. He could unleash terrible horrors.
You are the final piece he requires to complete the ritual - your scars bind you to it. Your soul will set off a very wave of death, bringing Cazador his twisted life.
You'll never be free while Cazador lives.
Of course I'll help. We'll hunt him down and kill him.
He thought I would dismember him but he has his uses so instead I am reeducating him.

EditorData.NodeContext: with a sadistic grin, relishing what you did to this creature that is no longer 'intact'

Text.Value: We delivered the devil. Now I want what I'm owed - we had a deal.
After we dealt with our tadpole problem, yes, I'll help you then.
As you wish. Brace yourself, Astarion - we're about to unveil your destiny.
But the ritual has its price, as all worthwhile things do. Lord Cazador will need to sacrifice a number of souls, including all of his vampiric spawn, if he is to ascend.
There's a way to become a living vampire... That must mean a lot to you.
The Absolute is a greater threat - we need to focus.
It promises to be a marvellous ceremony. Very elaborate, incredibly ancient, and entirely diabolical.
Oh come, Astarion. We're about to unveil your destiny - you should be quivering in anticipation.
The idea definitely has appeal.
He'll never leave me alone. I didn't think he would when I was just one more wretched toy for him to play with.
You're... quiet. It's unsettling.
As you know already, your precious skin is home to one part of a contract between the archdevil Mephistopheles, and your former master, Cazador Szarr.
Cazador is a piece of shit. We're going to stop him.
We're done talking about this, Astarion. My decision is made.
Not a chance.
He returned to me chastened but intact, his wounds healed, his body restored.
I could get rid of the worm in my head and still walk in the sun. I'd finally be free of the hunger.
How long do you think I can run? He has eternity to find me.
And if I'm the key to this deal of Cazador's, perhaps I can turn this to my advantage...
I was... contemplating. It's a lot to take in.
And I need you to help me.
Indeed we did. I discovered all there is to know about those scars of yours - it's a rather grim tale, even for my tastes.
Spill it - this sounds fascinating.
I'd appreciate a little less enthusiasm when it comes to Cazador and his horrors.
Thank you.
Carved into that ivory skin of yours is one part of an infernal contract between the archdevil Mephistopheles and your former master, Cazador Szarr.
Do you think it's so simple?
I think you should run. If Cazador can't find you, he can't complete his ritual.
Even if I wanted to walk away from all of this, I can't. Cazador won't let me.
You don't need to go back to Cazador - you're with me now.
'Hmm'? That's all you have to say?
If he completes the rite, he will become a new kind of being - the Vampire Ascendant.
In full, the contract states that Cazador will be granted knowledge of an infernal ritual so vile it has never been performed.
The end of my life among them. Just when I was starting to enjoy it.
But if I'm the key to this power he craves, he'll hunt me to the ends of Faerûn.
Do you know what happens when a devil is struck down on this charming plane of existence?
Please, give me more boring details about your plans.
If he comes for you, I'll defend you. But we're not risking an attack on his lair.
It's a lot to take in.
In the case of our friend Yurgir, the orthon you so handily dispatched in the temple of Shar, he manifested in my House of Hope.
Do you know what happens when a devil is struck down on this charming plane of existence?
All the strengths of his vampiric form will be amplified, and alongside them he will enjoy the luxuries of the living.
The only missing ingredient is Astarion.
What do you think I should do?
It returns to the hells - to the very point where it last stood before venturing to whichever devilforsaken plane it died on.
The arousals and appetites of man will return to him, and unlike Astarion, he will have no need of a parasite to protect him from the sun.
I knew he wouldn't leave me alone even when I was just another wretched toy for him to play with.
Are you sure you want to know, Astarion? Maybe it's best left in the past.
Come now, we're about to unveil your destiny - you should be quivering in anticipation.
I hate how right you are.
Fine.
I need to deal with Cazador while I still have any kind of advantage over him.
And that, my tragic and toothsome friend, is that. Now if you'll excuse me, I have business elsewhere.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Raphael disappears with a click of his fingers and a puff of smoke
EditorData.NodeContext: [Tarik] snaps fingers at the end of the line.
EditorData.SFXTags: Finger Snap and a "Puff" sound effect for the smoke cloud [DP]
EditorData.VFXTags: Puff of dense smoke to hide Raphael's exit [DP]

Text.Value: Stop stalling.
And why would he want to walk away? This is his destiny.
The Rite of Profane Ascension.
If you won't risk taking him on for my sake, think of the innocent souls he'll sacrifice in this ritual.

EditorData.NodeContext: Angry, but keeping it well in control. He didn't get the answer he wanted from the player.

Text.Value: Once we deal with the tadpole, I'll be back to my nocturnal self. When you're being hunted by vampires, the dark is the worst place to hide.
You're right - I'll help you destroy him.
Hmm...
Imagine how he felt, then, when one of those precious spawn simply disappeared into thin air.

Synopsis: Raphael tells Astarion about the contract Cazador made with a devil to become a super vampire.
